snippet: Officials are trying to determine the extent of illness, which has caused 700 deaths since the beginning of the year.
abstract: India's Health Ministry desperately tries to cope with influenza outbreak that has affected thousands and killed 700 since January; World Health Organization has identified strain as H1N1 seasonal flu, descendent of swine flu.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and HARI KUMAR
byline.contributor: Donald G. McNeil Jr. contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Officials are trying to determine the extent of illness, which has caused 700 deaths since the beginning of the year.

headline.main: India Deploys Expert Teams to Study Rise in Flu Cases
headline.print_headline: India Deploys Expert Teams to Study Rise in Flu Cases
